title: Everyday English Course 79
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Well, hello! Have you moved, or something?
M: No, I went to California for a few weeks.
W: Oh, really? Our new manager comes from California. Do you know that?
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Well, hello! Have you moved, or something?
M: No, I went to California for a few weeks.
W: Oh, really? Our new manager comes from California. Do you know that?
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Well, hello! Have you moved, or something?
M: No, I went to California for a few weeks.
W: Oh, really? Our new manager comes from California. Do you know that?
{a}

variables.a: What's the probable relationship between the two speakers?

answerOptions: It would be a better school.

variables.a: What's the woman's opinion about the school?

answerOptions: Nothing unusual happened at the office.
It was more interesting than he had expected.
instances.correctAnswer: Nothing unusual happened at the office.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Yes, I went with Alan on Saturday afternoon.
M: How was it?
W: Terrible! In the first half Birmingham only kicked the ball three or four times! Really bad. And it rained.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Yes, I went with Alan on Saturday afternoon.
M: How was it?
W: Terrible! In the first half Birmingham only kicked the ball three or four times! Really bad. And it rained.

M: How was it?
W: Terrible! In the first half Birmingham only kicked the ball three or four times! Really bad. And it rained.
{a}

variables.a: What are they talking about?

When will the meeting start?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: You look smart in this red jacket.
W: Thank you. A really good bargain, I think. You can get one for your sister. It goes on sale today.
M: Yes, but what size she takes.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: You look smart in this red jacket.
W: Thank you. A really good bargain, I think. You can get one for your sister. It goes on sale today.
M: Yes, but what size she takes.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:

W: Thank you. A really good bargain, I think. You can get one for your sister. It goes on sale today.
M: Yes, but what size she takes.
{a}

answerOptions: It is sold at a lower price.
instances.correctAnswer: It is sold at a lower price.

variables.a: What do we know about the woman's jacket?

answerOptions: It can help solve complex problems.
It will most likely prove ineffective.
It is a new weapon against terrorists.
instances.correctAnswer: It will most likely prove ineffective.

variables.a: What does the woman think of the new drug?
What's the gift?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: When do you usually go to the bank, John?
M: Anytime I have to. Why did you ask?
W: You'd better avoid Friday mornings. I'm reading an interesting book these days. And it says most robberies happen on Friday mornings.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: When do you usually go to the bank, John?
M: Anytime I have to. Why did you ask?
W: You'd better avoid Friday mornings. I'm reading an interesting book these days. And it says most robberies happen on Friday mornings.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: When do you usually go to the bank, John?
M: Anytime I have to. Why did you ask?
W: You'd better avoid Friday mornings. I'm reading an interesting book these days. And it says most robberies happen on Friday mornings.
{a}

answerOptions: To tell him about a bank robbery.
To recommend a good book to him.
To give him some advice on safety.
instances.correctAnswer: To give him some advice on safety.

variables.a: What is the woman's purpose in speaking to the man?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: She invites the man to a pot luck next weekend.
She asks the man to help her with the gardening.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: He doesn't want to go to his friend's party.
He will go to see the film.
He will go to his friend's party.
instances.correctAnswer: He will go to his friend's party.

variables.a: What does the man mean?
What color is Lily's sweater?

answerOptions: She enjoyed it as much as the man did.

variables.a: How did the woman like the lecture?
What are these two people talking about?
What did the man say about the final exam?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: We need some eggs, Catherine.
W: I'll drive out to the farm and get them tomorrow.
M: It'll be quicker to go to the market or to the little shop across the road.
W: I know, but I happen to know that they haven't been on the shelves for a long time.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: We need some eggs, Catherine.
W: I'll drive out to the farm and get them tomorrow.
M: It'll be quicker to go to the market or to the little shop across the road.
W: I know, but I happen to know that they haven't been on the shelves for a long time.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: We need some eggs, Catherine.
W: I'll drive out to the farm and get them tomorrow.
M: It'll be quicker to go to the market or to the little shop across the road.
W: I know, but I happen to know that they haven't been on the shelves for a long time.
{a}

variables.a: Where will the woman buy the eggs?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Guess who I met at the grocery store this morning?
M: Well, I can't imagine.
W: Do you remember Mr. Johnson? He used to live in the building next to ours.
M: Oh, yes, now I remember. He had dark hair and wore glasses.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:

M: Well, I can't imagine.
W: Do you remember Mr. Johnson? He used to live in the building next to ours.
M: Oh, yes, now I remember. He had dark hair and wore glasses.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: Who is Mr. Johnson according to the speakers?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What's the matter?
W: I've had a bad cold and cough all day and night.
M: Let me see. How long have you been like this?
W: About three days, ever since Tuesday.
{a}

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: The restaurant is too far from theirschool.
The price is high in the restaurant.

variables.a: What can we learn from the conversation?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Waiter, can we have the bill please?
M: Yes, madam. How will you pay for it, with cash or credit card,please?
W: With my Visa Card.
M: I'm awfully sorry, madam. But we only accept American Express and Master Card.
W: In that case, I'll pay with cash then.
M: Thank you, madam.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Waiter, can we have the bill please?
M: Yes, madam. How will you pay for it, with cash or credit card,please?
W: With my Visa Card.
M: I'm awfully sorry, madam. But we only accept American Express and Master Card.
W: In that case, I'll pay with cash then.
M: Thank you, madam.
{a}

variables.a: Which credit card is not accepted in this restaurant?

She expects to see him soon.
instances.correctAnswer: She doesn't believe he can do it.

answerOptions: Give his ankle a good rest.

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: I am not sure when to leave for the lecture.
W: But it's already fifteen to eight.
M: Take it easy. Fifteen minutes is quite OK.
{a}
